p: For the 1880–1908 cooling period, the CMIP5 All-Forcing multi-model ensemble forced response ( Fig. 6b) shows generally weak positive trends over most regions with relatively little resemblance to the observed trend map ( Fig. 6a). However, when this CMIP5 forced response is combined with the ten internal variability events from CM3 that produce the best agreement with observations ( Fig. 6c), the combined response matches better the observed 1880–1908 change pattern, reducing the mean absolute deviation with the observed trend by 16% compared with the forced response alone ( Fig. 6b). During this period, the CMIP5 ensemble global cooling response to the Krakatau eruption of 1883 (for example, Fig. 5c or ref. 30) was larger than the observed temporary cooling.
